pr_title: HDDS-4589: Handle potential data loss during ReplicationManager.handleOverReplicatedContainer()

timeline.message: HDDS-4589: Handle potential data loss during ReplicationManager.handleOverReplicatedContainer()
HDDS-4589: Handle potential data loss during ReplicationManager.handleOverReplicatedContainer()
HDDS-4589: Handle potential data loss during ReplicationManager.handleOverReplicatedContainer()

timeline.bodyText: So it seems will be hard to write a test to verify the case in HDDS-4589 :)
timeline.author: amaliujia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -720,6 +721,12 @@ private void handleOverReplicatedContainer(final ContainerInfo container,
 
       final List<ContainerReplica> eligibleReplicas = new ArrayList<>(replicas);
 
+      // Iterate replicas in deterministic order to avoid potential data loss.
+      // See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDDS-4589.
+      // N.B., sort replicas by (containerID, datanodeDetails).
+      eligibleReplicas.sort(
+          Comparator.comparingLong(ContainerReplica::hashCode));

replies.bodyText: Yeah. Such data loss issue exists on master as well, yet never reported.
replies.author: GlenGeng
